p: Three databases containing data from the Swiss national cattle population were used: (1) the Swiss Animal Movement Database (AMD), (2) the database owned by the Association of Swiss Cattle Breeders (ASR), and (3) the Swiss Laboratory Information System (ALIS). The AMD has been studied and reported to have potential value for SyS because of its relatively high quality in terms of population representativeness and reporting timeliness ( 11). The other two databases contain laboratory test orders (ALIS) and clinical data collected by farmers (ASR).These two databases haven't been investigated in Switzerland, but similar data have been reported to be of value for SyS in others countries ( 8).
